verse: In addition, David and the officers of the army set apart for service certain of the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun, who were to prophesy with lyres, harps, and cymbals. This is the list of the men set apart for this work of service.
From Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun were:
From Heman, the sons of Heman were:

All these were under the direction of their father to make music in the Lord’s house, with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of God’s house. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the direction of the king.
The number of them, with their brothers who were instructed in singing to the Lord, all of whom were skillful, was two hundred eighty-eight.
They cast lots for their offices, all alike, the least as well as the greatest, the teacher as well as the student.
